name: places/ChIJqd2yaHVZwokR1DAKYtycJGM
formattedAddress: 10 Nathan D Perlman Pl, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 10 Nathan D Perlman Pl, New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text: It’s a disaster trying to schedule an appointment. You can’t schedule online for a simple ultrasound and the first available appointment is weeks away.

text.text: It’s a disaster trying to schedule an appointment. You can’t schedule online for a simple ultrasound and the first available appointment is weeks away.

originalText.text: Please, for your own sake go somewhere else. Front desk is miserable to work with. This place rescheduled important MRIs 4 times, leaving me with 2 months waiting time. Once they rescheduled a YEAR in advance without informing me. Once I finally got an appointment, I walk in, the MRI machine is broken. I reschedule once again, just for the front desk to argue about my insurance not covering the scan even though I had confirmed approval THREE TIMES. Wait time is also unbelievably long. Only giving two stars because the MRI technicians were funny, friendly, and very helpful.

text.text: Please, for your own sake go somewhere else. Front desk is miserable to work with. This place rescheduled important MRIs 4 times, leaving me with 2 months waiting time. Once they rescheduled a YEAR in advance without informing me. Once I finally got an appointment, I walk in, the MRI machine is broken. I reschedule once again, just for the front desk to argue about my insurance not covering the scan even though I had confirmed approval THREE TIMES. Wait time is also unbelievably long. Only giving two stars because the MRI technicians were funny, friendly, and very helpful.

originalText.text:
Walked in, three people behind the desk- no one even looks up to say 'hi. Be right with you.'  Finally, a pleasant woman comes out from the Clinical area and greets me. Thank goodness. I might still be standing there.
She gets the receotiom staff to acknowledge me. My appointment was for 2PM. I arrived at 1:40. Good thing, as they had no record of me.. 'are you sure you have an appointment??' 'Yes. I am sure. You called me to confirm.''  They eventually figure that out and bring me back to the waiting room. No eye contact. Told to put on a gown and wait. Really? Wow.

I wait 1.5 hours and when I finally ask where I am in the queue, I am told that I am in the wrong place. ' Didn't anyone tell you?' they ask. Obviously not, since I've been sitting here an hour and a half.
A call to the front desk and an argument among staff follows.

I was finally seen by a very competent and polite technologist; if this review were just about her, it would be 5 stars. But, the reception and scheduling staff were so unwelcoming and disorganized, that I will think twice about continuing my care here.
